snippet: Amid signs of improvement in the overall jobs climate, manufacturing stands out as an area of strength in the American economy.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column observes for the first time in many years, manufacturing stands out as an area of strength in the American economy; notes employment in manufacturing jobs rose in 2010 and 2011, and manufactured exports also rose; cites monthly survey of manufacturers that shows more were hiring than firing for 27 consecutive months, the third-longest string since survey began in 1948.
lead_paragraph: Amid signs of improvement in the overall jobs climate, manufacturing stands out as an area of strength in the American economy.

headline.print_headline: Making More Things In the U.S.A.
headline.seo: U.S. Manufacturing Is a Bright Spot for the Economy
headline.main: Manufacturing Is Surprising Bright Spot in U.S. Economy
